intro: Nardostachys grandiflora, commonly known as sweet germander, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Valerianaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and spikes of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its calming and antispasmodic effects. Nardostachys grandiflora is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
